Sentence: After his (McCourt) mother, Angela, becomes pregnant with Frank, she (Angela) marries Malachy, the father of her (Angela) child
Angela struggles to feed her (Angela) growing family of sons, while Malachy spends his (Frank) wages on alcohol
Frank's much-loved baby sister, Margaret, dies and Angela falls into depression
More troubles plague the McCourts in Ireland: Angela has a miscarriage, Frank's two younger brothers die, and Malachy continues to drink away the family's money
Angela begins sleeping with Laman, an arrangement that makes Frank increasingly uncomfortable and angry
